node.title: SA oysters set to return to Christmas menus as shutdown eases
node.alt: A platter of oysters at an outlet on Coffin Bay.
node.description: Coffin Bay oyster growers breatheÂ a sigh of relief as production restrictions are gradually lifted following a gastro outbreak that halted sales at the busiest time of year.
node.content:
["Coffin Bay oysters are set to be back on\u00a0the menu for Christmas, with restrictions being lifted after a recent closure.", "The closure of oyster harvesting was put in place last month following\u00a0reports of consumers becoming ill with Vibrio parahaemolyticus after eating raw oysters.", "The shutdown is estimated to have cost growers hundreds of thousands of dollars in lost stock, as hundreds of kilograms of frozen produce had to be thrown away, and fresh harvesting was put on hold.", "Restrictions on growers will be progressively lifted from this week as individual businesses demonstrate the safety of their systems, with final clearance to be granted by SA Health.", "So far, SA Health has granted three emergency orders to allow Angel Seafood, Pristine Oyster Farm\u00a0and Southern Eyre Seafood to harvest and sell oysters from the Point Longnose Aquaculture Zone for their licensed areas only.", "Grower Isaac (Zac) Halman from Angel Seafood said\u00a0it was a relief to be able to sell his produce again.", "", "
Angel Seafood\u2019s Zac Halman assesses the quality of his Coffin Bay oysters.(ABC News: Brittany Evins)
", "Mr Halman said Angel Seafood was not\u00a0as badly affected by the recent closure as\u00a0some other growers, but said the company had been required to throw away some frozen goods.", "\"We had to get rid of some product from September and October, which was a kick in the guts,\" he said.", "\"We are\u00a0able to now restock that supply and that demand is starting to come back again \u2014 and even stronger \u2014 with the wholesalers and food services and retail.\"", "
Growers to feel ban losses 'for some time'
", "The South Australian Oyster Growers Association (SAOGA) welcomed the news but chairman Rob Kerin said it would\u00a0still take some time before all growers were able to resume harvesting.", "\"This is certainly a step in the right direction, but it's important to note the area will be re-opened progressively.", "", "
Coffin Bay on Eyre Peninsula is renowned for its oyster farming.(Supplied: Emma Jeffries)
", "Mr Kerin said he hoped\u00a0Australians would continue\u00a0to support oyster growers by buying their products.", "\"We need to continue to support them as they deal with the implementation of new control measures and get back on their feet, which could take longer for some growers than others,\" he said.", "\"In the meantime, we hope consumers will show their support by purchasing much-loved South Australian oysters as they progressively make their way back into the shops and into restaurants ahead of Christmas and beyond.\"", "
Oysters on the table for Christmas\u00a0
", "Mr Halman said he did not think that Coffin Bay would be left with a bad reputation due to the shutdown, and anticipated\u00a0strong Christmas sales.\u00a0", "\"I think the pristine environment \u2026 [will see] the region will come back pretty quick and this week we have seen significant demand for the product,\" said Mr Halman.\u00a0", "\"The sprit in the industry is also about getting behind everyone as well and it's looking like that will continue, so that is really good.\"", "", "
Primary Industries Minister David Basham says growers have handled the shut down well.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Clements)
", "Minister for Primary Industries and Regional Development David Basham said the state government had been working closely with the oyster industry to lift restrictions as soon as possible.", "\"The South Australian Oyster Growers Association has shown great leadership in working with growers to implement steps to give consumers confidence in our oysters,\" Mr Basham said.\u00a0", "\"Growers are implementing procedures to rapidly reduce the temperature of oysters after harvest to further reduce any likelihood of the presence of Vibrio bacteria.", "An investigation into the cause of the outbreak of Vibrio parahaemolyticus was\u00a0unable to conclusively determine what had caused the spike in cases, however it is suspected that high temperatures may have contributed.", "", "
The new FlipFarming method is a floating system which will allow workers to work from the boat and stay dry.(ABC News)
", "
More safeguards in place
", "Vibrio parahaemolyticus can be acquired by eating undercooked shellfish and fish, and like other food-borne illnesses can be more serious to vulnerable people,\u00a0such as the elderly, pregnant women\u00a0and those\u00a0with compromised immune systems.", "Ms Halman said the industry was already on top of safety precautions, but the recent incident would\u00a0help with even better practices moving forward.", "\"Obviously, industry will work on how and why this came about, but we just have to be mindful that it is always present,\" he said.", "\"I think it has probably been a good reminder to keep all the processes in good check. \""]
